summary: The temporalio Ruby gem fails to install from source in Docker on aarch64-linux due to Cargo manifest issues with the temporalio_bridge library. The issue occurs despite the correct platform being available, suggesting a dependency resolution problem.
userImpact: Users trying to install the temporalio gem in Docker containers on aarch64-linux are blocked from using the SDK due to build failures.
rootCause: Bundler is selecting the source gem instead of the aarch64-linux prebuilt gem, causing Cargo to fail when parsing the manifest because the temporalio_bridge library cannot be found in the source build.
workaround: Add aarch64-linux to the PLATFORMS section in Gemfile.lock to force selection of the prebuilt gem.
resolutionDetails: The gem maintainers clarified that building from source is not supported and prebuilt gems are available; the workaround of adding the platform to Gemfile.lock solved the user's issue.
keyQuote: This gem does not support building from a source gem at this time... I wonder why it is getting the source gem instead of the aarch64-linux one.
